event: Earliest human settlement in present-day Lithuania after Ice Age retreat
Baltic tribes establish farming communities and regional cultures
Lithuanian tribes consolidate power in the Baltic region
Lithuanians defeat crusading forces, preserving independence
Mindaugas is crowned as the first King of Lithuania
Grand Duchy of Lithuania expands across Eastern Europe
Union with Poland begins through dynastic alliance
Lithuania converts to Christianity, last pagan state in Europe
Joint Polish-Lithuanian victory at Grunwald weakens Teutonic Order
Grand Duchy reaches its greatest territorial extent
Wars devastate Lithuania, weakening the Commonwealth
Lithuania is absorbed into the Russian Empire
Lithuania declares independence after World War I
Soviet occupation begins during World War II
Nazi occupation devastates Jewish and urban communities
Soviet rule is reimposed after World War II
Lithuania becomes the first Soviet republic to declare independence
Lithuania joins the European Union and NATO
